pageContext.claim: “I mean, I can make it 10 per cent and people could stand that very easily. But if you read that recent poll that came out, we're only being -- most of this is being -- the brunt of it is being paid by China. You saw that...on the tariffs.”
pageContext.analysis: The tariffs are not being paid by Chinese exporters, but U.S. importers -- who pass most of the costs on to U.S. consumers. So it's really a tax on Americans.
